data.title: Beautiful houses...
data.text: Took the horse and buggy tour of this district.  As always we were not disappointed by the beauty that Charleston has to offer.

data.title: Beautiful, Relaxing Afternoon
data.text: I've been in the Triad Area many times but had not taken the time to come to Old Salem. I must say, I was quite impressed. The Visitor Center is HUGE and full of great information. The relaxing stroll through the quaint streets was perfect for me and my 9 year old niece. Pretty, Nostalgic, Historic & Fun !   I'll Be Back !!

data.title: Historic neighborhood
data.text: West End is the oldest and closest neighborhood to downtown Winston-Salem. Many of the older houses are still standing and have been renovated. The yards are mostly well-kept and neat, with flowers and trees. It's worth a drive or a walk through to see the houses and Grace Park.

data.title: Must See Winston-Salem Historic Area
data.text: Visitors and locals alike should invest the time to take an excursion back in time and see a historic area of this wonderful city. The homes are interesting and the ambience of the area speak to a more gentile type of living.

data.title: Beautiful historic area
data.text: This is a wonderful walkable area with a great park area, winding streets, beautiful homes, and fabulous restaurants.  Adjacent Burke Street has many wonderful businesses and restaurants to visit as well.

data.title: great area
data.text: great area.  good location.  lots of nice restaurants to visit.  good area to walk and visit in.  very family friendly. nice parks in the area.

data.title: My roots Revisited
data.text: My grandfather brought the house on Fourth Street in the 1920s. Their 5 children grew-up in that neighborhood. We were at the house all the time in the 1950s- early 1960s. My memories of that neighborhood don't do it justice today. Many of the houses have been updated and remodeled but still hold the flavor of the 1920s. My Aunt,  now in her 80s, was not sure the oicture I had was her house. I finally convinced her when she saw the small garage in the back. The old Sears building was close enough to walk to. It has been replaced with shops and restaurants dotting the streets of this restored historic district. Trees are lining the streets offering shade on warm days to those who chose to eat at the sidewalk tables. A step into the past was a nice way to end a long day of touring.

data.title: Blast from the past
data.text: We were being casual tourists one day and my mother in law took us here. It was like stepping back in time. It was a great day. There were old shops and buildings everywhere. We had a great time. You have to go, it's a must see. We spent the whole day there.

data.title: An interesting little town
data.text: Being from Canada I have never seen tobacco leaves before. Experiencing Winston-Salem and it's tobacco history, was quite different and strangely charming. Lots of great little shops and artists.

data.title: A great  area of town
data.text: This part of Winston is an excellent example of restoration work and  historic importance come together. A lovely area to visit offers another side of the city

data.title: Charming district and home to some of the best restaurants
data.text: It's OK,if you get lost trying to find one of many great dining spots in the West End because then you will,get to enjoy the beautiful older homes, mature landscapes and quaint parks like Grace Court. There is a wide variety of restaurants around Brookstown and Fourth, put also a few places near Hanes Park for gelato and breakfast. Also lots of places to grab a beer and sit outside.

data.title: Beautiful Homes
data.text: Great for a walk if you enjoy Victorian architecture. Lots of homes from the early 1900s. There is a lovely memorial park by the episcopal church, and some sweet little thrift shops down by Hanes Park.

data.title: Nice funky neighborhood
data.text: Many galleries, bars, restaurants.  Great for shopping and people watching.  A lot of people out on a Saturday afternoon.  Very funky, nicely done and cared for.

data.title: West End
data.text: Little quaint shops galore, with unique treasures to browse through. Eat at the Greek Restaurant on the Hill, and don't dare miss The Snob Shop!

data.title: Fab Historic area offering great walks and good food
data.text: Cruising through West End via car or on foot or on a bike -- all are great ways to see the area (though be ready to climb a few hills). Really cool area with lots of unique homes built in different eras. Most everything has been left intact by city including narrow streets but it is worth it to venture through. Slow down and enjoy!

data.title: BEAUTIFUL NEIGHBORHOOD WITH BEAUTIFUL HOMES !!!
data.text: The West End Neighborhood is a very eclectic area near the Downtown area of Winston Salem. It has a mix of renters and home owners unique to the Winston Salem area. Many of the older homes have been restored while some others that were converted into apartments are occupied by a wide array of residents. It is a walkable neighborhood very near everything including Hanes Park and the Downtown Arts District.

data.title: Nice to See a Part of History
data.text: As a child, we would venture through this section of town and admire the beautiful homes .  Then as time went by, people moved away and some of the houses lost their stateliness. I am glad to see that Winston-Salem has been on a revitalization movement for several years, The homes now remind you of what was back then. Restaurants and bars, and shops dot the surrounding areas. Downtown is also doing a good job of reinventing itself as well. Take a Saturday afternoon and enjoy the surroundings of W-S.

data.title: Lots of beautiful homes and great restaurants!
data.text: I really enjoyed the time we spent in the West End Historic District of Winston-Salem.  Lots of beautiful, historic homes on big lots, very close to downtown and easy to reach by car or on foot. Nearby Hanes Park was nice and there were lots of great restaurants and shops to check out.

data.title: Really neat historic village
data.text: An entire village just as it was back then.  People in period dress.  Shops and restaurants much like they must have been....

data.title: Food, drink and stately homes...
data.text: The West End Historic District contains some of the city's most beautiful old homes and historic sites.  There are several excellent restaurants - Bernardin's, West End Cafe, Fourth Street Filling Station and several more.  Burke Street has several lively bars, grilles and a pizza joint or two.  Lots of young people, noise and music.  BE AWARE - Despite police patrols, street crime is a problem in the area, especially late at night.  Be careful !
